reasoning: The transcription details the process of preparing a simple chicken dish with potatoes and onions, seasoned with salt, pepper, Spanish paprika, and herbs de Provence, and then baked in the oven. The steps have been extracted based on the sequence of actions described by Jacques Pepin, starting with preparing the potato and ending with the dish being ready after baking.
dish_description: The dish is a simple and delicious chicken thigh cooked with potatoes and onions, seasoned with salt, pepper, Spanish paprika, and herbs de Provence, and baked in the oven.

cooking_steps.description: Prepare the potato by removing any black parts and cutting it into 4 or 5 pieces.
Add a couple of tablespoons of olive oil to a pan and place the potato pieces in it.
Cut half of a big onion (about 4 ounces) and add it to the pan with the potatoes.
Arrange the potatoes and onions in one layer in the pan and cook for a couple of minutes until they start to brown. Season with salt and pepper.
Turn the potatoes and onions over to cook on the other side.
Add 2 cloves of garlic to the pan and season with about half a teaspoon of salt and a dash of pepper.
Prepare the chicken thigh by cutting a little bit along the bone on each side to help with cooking. Season with about a quarter teaspoon of salt, Spanish paprika, and herbs de Provence.

Place the seasoned chicken thigh on top of the potatoes and onions in the pan and bake in the oven at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 25 to 30 minutes until the chicken is tender and the vegetables are cooked.
